title: Electromagnetism - flip loop wire magnetic field

content.question: (a) Indicate whether <math alttext="open script E sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is less than, equal to, or greater than <math alttext="open script E sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>Ɛ</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math>. Justify your response without manipulating equations.

frqParts.text: (a) Indicate whether <math alttext="open script E sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is less than, equal to, or greater than <math alttext="open script E sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>Ɛ</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math>. Justify your response without manipulating equations.

(b) The loop of wire has resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. Derive an expression for the current <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in the loop as it is being pulled out of the region of uniform magnetic field in Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> in terms of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>, <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>ℓ</mo></math>, and <math alttext="w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>w</mi></math>, as appropriate.

(c) A student claims that in Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the induced current in the loop could be equal to <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> if the loop is pulled with a greater speed. Indicate whether the student’s claim is correct or incorrect.Briefly justify your answer by referring to the derivation in part (b).

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
